item.title: Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December - News18
item.description:
Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December

Publication Date: January 14, 2025 Source: News18

Wholesale price inflation rose to 2.37 per cent in December 2024, led by a spike in manufactured products even though prices of food items eased, according to government data.

  • The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation was 1.89 per cent in November 2024 and 0.86 per cent in December 2023.
  • Inflation in food items eased to 8.47 per cent in December 2024 from 8.63 per cent in November.
  • Inflation in potato remained high at 93.20 per cent, while onion saw a spike to 16.81 per cent in December.
  • Fuel and power category recorded a deflation of 3.79 per cent in December.
“Retail inflation data released on Monday showed that consumer price index (CPI) based inflation eased to 4-month low of 5.22 per cent in December on easing food prices.”

This increase in wholesale price inflation reflects underlying pressures in the economy, despite some easing in food prices, which may influence future consumer prices.

item.title: India’s disinflation progress could derail amid sharp rupee depreciation - Moneycontrol
item.description:
India’s Disinflation Progress Could Derail Amid Sharp Rupee Depreciation

Date: January 14, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee has depreciated by 3.2% against the US dollar, which may hinder the country’s disinflationary progress, leading to higher import costs and inflation.

  • The Indian rupee has faced a notable depreciation, becoming the second least volatile currency after the Hong Kong dollar.
  • Experts warn that increased import costs may translate into imported inflation.
  • Economists indicate that sectors reliant on imported raw materials will face escalating costs, impacting consumer prices and spending.
  • Retail inflation in India saw a decline to 5.22% in December, thanks to easing food prices.

Aditi Gupta, Economist at Bank of Baroda: “Sectors heavily dependent on imported raw materials are likely to witness escalation in costs due to higher input prices, impacting margins.”

The sharp depreciation of the rupee poses significant challenges to India's economic stability, making it essential for policymakers to address the potential inflationary pressures while supporting growth.

item.title: 90-hour workweek row: ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri says ‘would not do it’, bats for flexibility, employee empowerment | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Advocates for Employee Empowerment Amid 90-Hour Workweek Debate

Date: January 14, 2023 Source: Live Mint

In light of the recent 90-hour workweek controversy, ITC Ltd Chairman Sanjiv Puri emphasized the importance of aligning employees with the company's vision rather than focusing strictly on work hours. He highlighted the company's flexible work environment, including work-from-home options.

  • Sanjiv Puri remarked that ITC would not enforce strict work hour limits.
  • The focus should be on employee engagement and contribution to the company's goals.
  • Puri described a vision analogy, comparing workers’ perspectives to builders constructing a castle.
  • He mentioned the flexibility offered by ITC, including two work-from-home days per week.
“What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife, and how long can the wife stare at the husband.” - Sanjiv Puri

In conclusion, Puri advocates that organizations should enable individuals to fulfill their potential rather than merely track hours worked.

item.title: ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors - News18
item.description:
ITC Hotels Shares Credited To Demat Accounts Post Allotment; Key Points For Investors

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: News18

Shares of ITC Hotels have been credited to the Demat accounts of eligible ITC shareholders following the allotment. The allotment was announced on Saturday, January 11, and the shares were credited to Demat accounts on Monday, January 13.

  • ITC shareholders received an SMS notification from their depository regarding the credit of ITC Hotels shares to their Demat accounts.
  • The share allotment ratio is 10:1 according to the demerger scheme.
  • On January 11, ITC Ltd announced the allotment of shares to shareholders as of the record date January 6, 2025.
  • A total of 125.11 crore equity shares of ITC Hotels have been allotted.
  • The shares are currently shown as a dummy ticker in Demat accounts.
  • ITC Hotels will be listed on the NSE and BSE, expected before mid-February 2025.
“The Board of Directors of ITC Hotels Limited met on January 11, 2025, and allotted 125,11,71,040 equity shares of Re 1 each,” said ITC in the filing.

The credit of ITC Hotels shares marks a significant event for shareholders, as it transitions to a separate entity with expectations of an official market listing soon.

item.title: RBI to judiciously handle forex reserves amid headwinds: Report - Deccan Herald
item.description:
RBI to judiciously handle forex reserves amid headwinds: Report

Published: 14 January 2025, 10:51 IST

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is adopting a cautious approach in using foreign exchange reserves to manage the volatility in the domestic currency market due to global economic challenges.

  • The RBI will intervene to smoothen volatility but will avoid excessive intervention.
  • There has been a significant decline in India's foreign exchange reserves, approximately $50 billion since early November.
  • The rupee depreciated about 3% against the US dollar following Trump's election.
  • Newly-appointed Governor Sanjay Malhotra is in regular contact with various departments to manage currency stability.
  • The RBI is allowing banks more flexibility in market activity and arbitrage.
"Reserves were built for a rainy day... since Trump's win, it is clear that there is no point in excessive intervention."

The RBI's approach reflects a shift towards measured responses to currency fluctuations, balancing market needs with economic fundamentals.

item.title: How China wants to press pause on India's Apple success story - The Economic Times
item.description:
How China wants to press pause on India's Apple success story

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Economic Times

China is taking steps to stifle India’s burgeoning Apple manufacturing sector amid concerns over its rapid progress in the domestic electronics industry, which relies heavily on Chinese machinery and components.

  • India's Apple manufacturing relies on equipment and components from China.
  • China is reportedly halting the supply of crucial high-tech machinery needed for production.
  • Foxconn, a major supplier, faces challenges in relocating staff and equipment from China.
  • India's local value addition in manufacturing has increased significantly, reaching 15-20% in various models.
  • Despite delays, India aims to improve its production capabilities and attract other manufacturers.
  • Strategic geopolitical tensions between India and China may further complicate the situation.
“Apple’s achievement remains unparalleled in a year for any single product export from India,” a government official stated.

China's actions to curtail the supply of essential manufacturing resources could pose significant challenges to India's ambitions in electronics manufacturing. However, with ongoing efforts to localize production, India may still find pathways for success in this competitive landscape.

item.title: PSU Bank Stake Sale: Government approves ₹10,000 crore QIP plan for five lenders — Exclusive - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Government Greenlights ₹10,000 Crore Fundraising for Five PSU Banks

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

The government has approved a ₹10,000 crore fundraising plan for five state-run lenders through the Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP) route.

  • Five banks approved include Bank of Maharashtra, Punjab & Sind Bank, Indian Overseas Bank, UCO Bank, and Central Bank of India.
  • The fundraising may commence in small tranches starting from Q4 of FY 2025.
  • The government aims to meet 25% minimum public shareholding norms by August 2026.
  • The government holds substantial stakes in these banks, with Bank of Maharashtra at 79.6% and Punjab & Sind Bank at 98.25%.
  • The current excess government stake in these banks is nearly ₹50,000 crore.
“The government holds a significant stake across these five banks, with intentions to enhance public shareholding.”

This approval is part of the government's strategy to bolster the financial status of PSU banks and meet regulatory requirements for shareholding.

item.title: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra signals he’s open to more flexible rupee - The Economic Times
item.description:
RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra Open to a More Flexible Rupee

Publication Date: January 8, 2021 Source: Economic Times

India's central bank governor, Sanjay Malhotra, indicates a shift towards allowing the rupee to move more freely. He aims to balance flexibility with interventions to curb excessive volatility in the foreign-exchange market.

  • Malhotra has held meetings discussing currency interventions and the need for rupee depreciation.
  • There may be a departure from former Governor Shaktikanta Das's strict currency control.
  • The rupee has faced a slump of 2% against the dollar since Das's departure, influenced by a strong US dollar and rising oil prices.
  • Manufacturers expressed concerns that a stable rupee hurt competitiveness against countries allowing depreciation.
“The RBI’s tight grip over the currency has meant that the currency’s real effective exchange rate has risen to a record.”

Overall, the RBI is expected to adopt a more flexible approach towards the rupee while maintaining a close watch on market stability and investor sentiment.
